repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes: #20183

Problem: Some LSPs register `textDocument/didSave` dynamically so that they can specify globPatterns for files that they arent directly attached to. eg `rust-anylyzer` registers for `cargo.toml`. This allows the server to react to changes in the environment/project.

Solution: Enable dynamic registration of `textDocument/didSave` creating autocommands to notify of save events for buffers matching globPatterns from the server

comment_data.body: Why are we now handling `buf_state` being `nil`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,10 +168,13 @@ end
 --- @param client vim.lsp.Client
 --- @param bufnr integer
 --- @param name string
---- @return string
+--- @return string | nil
 function M._get_and_set_name(client, bufnr, name)
   local state = state_by_group[get_group(client)] or {}
   local buf_state = (state.buffers or {})[bufnr]
+  if not buf_state then

comment_data.body: If this is specific to the `textDocument/didSave` method I would rename this method to `_registerDidSave`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -822,13 +822,40 @@ function lsp.start_client(config)
   return create_and_init_client(config)
 end
 
+--- Registers the textDocument/didSave capability dynamically.
+---
+---@param reg lsp.Registration LSP Registration object.
+---@param client_id integer Client ID.
+function lsp._register(reg, client_id)

@@ -822,13 +822,40 @@ function lsp.start_client(config)
   return create_and_init_client(config)
 end
 
+--- Registers the textDocument/didSave capability dynamically.
+---
+---@param reg lsp.Registration LSP Registration object.
+---@param client_id integer Client ID.
+function lsp._register(reg, client_id)
+  assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id), 'Client must be running')
+  local group = api.nvim_create_augroup(
+    ('nvim.lsp.dynamicDidSave_%d_%s'):format(client_id, reg.id),
+    { clear = true }
+  )
+  local register_options = reg.registerOptions --[[@as lsp.TextDocumentSaveRegistrationOptions]]
+  ---@type table<string, {pattern: vim.lpeg.Pattern, kind: lsp.WatchKind}[]> by base_dir
+  for _, s in ipairs(register_options.documentSelector) do
+    vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufWritePost', {

comment_data.body: From [the spec](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#textDocumentSyncClientCapabilities) it seems like this property is general to all text synchronization methods. With this PR are we now supporting dynamic registration for all of those?

Because the globPattern might match a file that the client isn't attached too. 
Eg `rust-analyzer` requests a globPattern of `**/cargo.toml`. Which the client isn't attached too, so there is no buf_state
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,10 +168,13 @@ end
 --- @param client vim.lsp.Client
 --- @param bufnr integer
 --- @param name string
---- @return string
+--- @return string | nil
 function M._get_and_set_name(client, bufnr, name)
   local state = state_by_group[get_group(client)] or {}
   local buf_state = (state.buffers or {})[bufnr]
+  if not buf_state then

comment_data.body:
Yes, I have just re-read the spec (from the metamodel) as sometimes thats
easier.

And yes you are right, we would need to support dynamicRegistration for all of:

- textDocument/willSaveWaitUntil
- textDocument/didOpen
- textDocument/didChange
- textDocument/didClose
- textDocument/didSave âœ…
- textDocument/willSave

They are all fairly similar, except for `textDocument/didChange`, as that would
require tracking the state documents that the client isn't attached to
potentially. That could be pretty horrible
Got it. In that case we should undo this capability change.

Yes, but it's dead code without the capability as the server would never try to register the capability, as we are saying that we don't support it.

Ultimately, we need to implement all the functionality before we change the capability.
Would you rather 
- I implement the functionality across multiple PRs, then toggle the capability once its all done. 
Or 
- I can convert this back to a draft, and implement the other 5 methods?
I see. To avoid having dead code while we enable the capability, I think it's fine to add support for all the text sync methods in a single PR.

title: feat(lsp): support dynamic registration for didSave
